::Prowl::

Darkness.. Something wasn't right, Prowl knew that. He could feel the 
pain in his wing, he could feel his dented torso and limbs, but he 
couldn't feel his head. Trying to access optics or audio sensors, 
Prowl's system reports that they were not there.

The Maximal reaches up to touch his head. It was there, but there 
must be a broken connection somewhere along the way to his core 
proccessor. His scanners reported that Iron Raptor was near him, but 
he couldn't say, hear, or see anything. He couldn't even feel his 
head, much less nod it.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> * Iron Raptor knew that he was going to try and stop her now, and 
just as 
> Prowl was about to dig his talons into her she was getting ready to 
kick 
> back and get him away.
> But instead, when she expected to feel him grab her she heard a few 
frantic 
> flapps of wings, a sickening crack, a few more cracks which were 
branches of 
> the forest she had just entered and another bonysounding snap.
> 
> She looked back over her shoulder as she ran to look for Prowl, but 
the 
> forst was to dense to see anything in it other then the bushes and 
tree.
> Her eyes scanned the area...but a little accident of her own was 
just about 
> to happen!
> Not looking where she was going she ran smack dab right into a 
large tree 
> trunk, her shoulder hit first and the trunk shattered from the 
impact.
> Brought to a dead stop she staggered back for a few steps before 
she simply 
> sat down hard on her rear, sitting there stunned for a few moments 
as she 
> just watched the tree creek and goran as it slowly fell to the 
ground, 
> taking a few others with it.
> 
> But then she simply shook her hed and looked down at her shoulder, 
a little 
> yellow mech-fluid leeking from it. Nothing seriouse.
> Iron Raptor got to herfeet and then raised to her hind legs, taking 
the 
> weight off her shoulder which was already damaged.
> She looked around the new clearing for a moment before turning 
back, knowing 
> that Prowl would have to be there somewhere.
> 
> It wasn't long before she finally found him, just freshly fallen 
from the 
> trees above...since all the branches were broken and hanging.
> He must have ran into a branch as he swooped down on her, then went 
through 
> everything else until he finally landed on his stomach on the 
forest floor.
> Iron Raptor sighed and walked up to him, seeing his wing which 
looked to be 
> broken. Worry on her features.*
> 
> " Prowl?"
> 
> 
> He
> >transforms and falls to the ground, landing on his stomach as he 
hits
> >several more branches.
> 
> 
>
